homophobic the n-word is used some 17
times and Blazing Saddles traffics in
every kind of ethnic insult humor you
can imagine and some kinds you probably
never even dreamed of but the movies not
racist it's a bold and provocative
critique of racism both in the
traditional Hollywood Western and in
American culture at large now Mel Brooks
originally wanted Richard Pryor to play
the part of Bart the sheriff and Pryor
collaborated with Brooks on the script
for Blazing Saddles and that's a key
factor in this film because Pryor in the
1970s in his stand-up work and in his
writing was uniquely capable of making
audiences of all races laugh at the
things that made them most uncomfortable
